title: Sebastien Vahaamahina's ridiculous red-card assault rescued Wales and elbowed France out of a Rugby World Cup - he has to live with that
text:
Sherlock Holmes was not needed to see that Moriarty had committed a crime with a neck-high tackle. Nor was Poirot, the French prop, required to investigate the finer points of Sebastien Vahaamahina’s ridiculous elbow to the jaw of Aaron Wainwright - the catalyst for France’s latest implosion.

When it was over and France were undone by a point, Vahaamahina trudged back out in his flip-flops to tap hands with his team-mates, who looked as if they wanted nothing to do with him. If only they had told their deluded second-rower that World Cup matches are observed by dozens of cameras as...
description: Sherlock Holmes was not needed to see that Moriarty had committed a crime with a neck-high tackle.
